channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Supreme Court to hear case about emergency abortion care
item.description: The Supreme Court will hear oral arguments in another major abortion access case as it grapples with the aftermath of reversing Roe v. Wade. Follow here for live audio of the arguments, news updates, analysis and more.

item.title: Traces of H5N1 bird flu virus found in some milk, pasteurized dairy: FDA
item.description: The USDA and FDA said the commercial milk supply remains safe for now.

item.title: Protests at Columbia and other schools continue into day eight
item.description: Columbia University, and other schools have taken steps to try to address students' concerns over safety and freedom of expression.

item.title: Boeing's crash agreement with DOJ under scrutiny
item.description: Families of crash victims are set to meet with prosecutors on Wednesday.

item.title: Devastation in Gaza as Israel wages war on Hamas
item.description: The US Senate has passed a funding package that will provide $26.4 billion to aid Israel and includes sanctions on Iran. Follow for live updates

item.title: USDA updates rules for school meals that limit added sugars for the first time
item.description: U.S. agriculture officials announced new nutrition standards for school meals that will limit added sugars for the first time

item.title: April 23, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
item.description: After 200 days of war, Israeli attacks in Gaza have killed more than 34,000 Palestinians, according to the enclave's health ministry. CNN cannot independently confirm the numbers due to the lack of international media access.

item.title: Woman is 1st patient to undergo combined heart pump implant and pig kidney transplant
item.description: In a first-of-its-kind procedure, a terminally ill New Jersey woman received a pig kidney transplant and a surgically implanted mechanical heart pump.

item.title: Protests at Columbia and other schools escalate
item.description: Officials at Columbia University, facing surging tensions on campus, have taken steps to try to address students' concerns over safety and freedom of expression.

item.title: Surging auto insurance rates squeeze drivers, fuel inflation
item.description: Relentlessly rising auto insurance rates are squeezing car owners and stoking inflation
